availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Virginia-born, Tennessee miller and farmer. Married to Mary Brandon Lawson Davis. Father of Isaac H. Davis, Andrew Alexander Davis, Elizabeth “Sallie” Davis, William “Willie” P. Davis, Morelle Davis, Mary Tabitha Davis, Cato A. Davis, Jr., John C. Davis, Allen Ripley Davis, and Bernard Davis. Owned ten enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Obion County, Civil District No 2, p. 240; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Obion County, Civil District No 2, p. 32; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Obion County, District No 2, p. 24; Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Obion County, Civil District No 2, p. 20; “Cato Aristides Davis,” (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=Davis&GSiman=1&GScty=137866&GRid=136757182&) (accessed on February 16, 1017).
